channel.title: math.GT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A vanishing criterion for cup products and Massey products in bounded cohomology
item.description: arXiv:2407.17034v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We give a uniform vanishing criterion for products in bounded cohomology. This allows us to reprove and extend previous vanishing results for cup products and Massey triple products in the bounded cohomology of free groups and in the equivariant bounded cohomology of group actions on CAT(0) cube complexes.
item.dc:creator: Franziska Hofmann

item.title: Involutive bordered Floer homology
item.description: arXiv:1706.06557v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We give a bordered extension of involutive HF-hat and use it to give an algorithm to compute involutive HF-hat for general 3-manifolds. We also explain how the mapping class group action on HF-hat can be computed using bordered Floer homology. As applications, we prove that involutive HF-hat satisfies a surgery exact triangle and compute HFI-hat of the branched double covers of all 10-crossing knots.
item.dc:creator: Kristen Hendricks, Robert Lipshitz

item.title: Thick braids and other non-trivial homotopy in configuration spaces of hard discs
item.description: arXiv:2311.16776v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We investigate the homotopy groups of the configuration space of hard discs inside a unit disc, just beyond the first critical radius. In the four-disc case, we find a non-contractible `thick braid' (loop in the configuration space), which contracts in the ordered configuration space of points when we replace each disc by its centre. For $n\ge 5$ discs, we find a non-contractible $(n-3)$-sphere, and we explore the persistence of this homotopy class when the ambient unit disc is deformed. For sufficiently large $n$, we demonstrate the existence of non-trivial $\pi_k$-classes with $k<n-3$ beyond higher critical radii.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Ramsey

item.title: Relative Group Trisections
item.description: arXiv:2406.14530v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Trisections of closed 4-manifolds, first defined and studied by Gay and Kirby, have proved to be a useful tool in the systematic analysis of 4-manifolds via handlebodies. Subsequent work of Abrams, Gay, and Kirby established a connection with the algebraic notion of a group trisection, which strikingly defines a one-to-one correspondence. We generalize the notion of a group trisection to the non-closed case by defining and studying relative group trisections. We establish an analogous one-to-one correspondence between relative trisections and relative group trisections up to equivalence. The key lemma in the construction may be of independent interest, as it generalizes the classical fact that there is a unique handlebody extension of a surface realizing a given surjection. Moreover, we establish a functorial relationship between relative trisections of manifolds and groups, extending work of Klug in the closed case.
item.dc:creator: Nickolas Andres Castro, Jason Joseph, Patrick K. McFaddin

item.title: Scalar curvature and volume entropy of hyperbolic 3-manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2312.00138v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We show that any closed hyperbolic 3-manifold M admits a Riemannian metric with scalar curvature at least -6, but with volume entropy strictly larger than 2. In particular, this construction gives counterexamples to a conjecture of I. Agol, P. Storm and W. Thurston.
item.dc:creator: Demetre Kazaras, Antoine Song, Kai Xu
